      • Controller

                  Player playerModel,
                  java.util.ArrayList<Interactable> interactableModels,

                  ScoreBoard scoreBoard,
                  FinishLine FinishLine)
        Instantiates a new controller.

        menuModel - the menu model
        playerModel - the player model
        interactableModels - the interactable models
        backgroundModels - the background models
        scoreBoard - the score board
        FinishLine - the finish line

    • Method Detail

      • tick

        public void tick()
        Called every tick by the gameWrapper main loop. Depending on the current game state, the appropriate onTick function is called. This function then updates the view.

      • setInteractablesToTutorialSet

        public void setInteractablesToTutorialSet()
        Sets the interactable models to a controlled tutorial set.

      • pauseActiveGameStateModels

        public void pauseActiveGameStateModels()
        Pauses active game state models for the tutorial.

      • resumeActiveGameStateModels

        public void resumeActiveGameStateModels()
        Resumes the active game state for the tutorial.

      • triggerTutorialStepDisplay

        public void triggerTutorialStepDisplay(int step)
        Displays the appropriate text field during the tutorial.
        Parameters:
        step - The step of the text field currently being shown

      • changeLevels

        public void changeLevels(java.lang.String targetLevel)
        Changes the sprites of the models to reflect the current level environment (water or air).
        Parameters:
        targetLevel - the level to change to (a for air, or w for water)

      • resetLevel

        public void resetLevel()
        resets the current level by setting the model properties to their starting values.

      • generateInteractableModels

        private java.util.ArrayList<Interactable> generateInteractableModels()
        Generates interactable models based on the amount of interactables and the release time intervals set in the globalSettings.properties file.
        Returns:
        the ArrayList of interactable models

      • changeGameStateFromMenuToActive

        public void changeGameStateFromMenuToActive()
        Changes the game state from menu to active.

      • changeGameStateFromActiveToMinigame

        public void changeGameStateFromActiveToMinigame()
        Changes the game state from active to minigame.

      • changeGameStateFromGameOverToMenu

        public void changeGameStateFromGameOverToMenu()
        Changes the game state from game over to menu.

      • changeGameStateFromMiniGameToActive

        public void changeGameStateFromMiniGameToActive(int correctAnswerCount)
        Changes the game state from mini game to active. If the player answers more than zero questions correct, a helper method is called
        Parameters:
        correctAnswerCount - The amount of questions answered correctly by the player in the miniGame's main loop

      • changeGameStateFromActiveToGameOver

        public void changeGameStateFromActiveToGameOver()
        Changes the game state from active to game over.

      • setPlayerName

        public void setPlayerName(java.lang.String playerName)
        Sets the player name.
        Parameters:
        playerName - new player name
